Legal_Issue: Whether the Board's decision to deny refugee protection based on lack of religious knowledge was reasonable
Application_Facts: Applicant feared persecution in China due to his Roman Catholic faith and sought refugee protection in Canada
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed; case remitted for redetermination by a different Board
Defendant_Behavior: Board denied refugee protection based on perceived lack of credible religious knowledge
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution based on religion in China
Legal_Standard: Standard of review for factual findings, including credibility, is reasonableness
Assessment_Factor: Credibility of applicant's religious beliefs based on knowledge of Roman Catholicism
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review under s 72(1) of IRPA
Credibility_Assessment: Board focused on minor errors in religious knowledge; Court found expectations unreasonably high
Evidence_Used: Applicant's answers to questions about Roman Catholic faith
Application_Basis: Claim for refugee protection under IRPA based on religious persecution
Evidence_Assessed: Applicant correctly answered many religious knowledge questions
Relief_Sought: Overturning of Board's decision and redetermination of refugee claim
Governing_Rule: The Court can intervene if the Board's decision is outside the range of acceptable outcomes
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Board's reliance on minor errors despite substantial correct responses
Outcome: Decision set aside; matter remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution in country of origin due to religious belief
Cause_Description: Applicant fears persecution in China because of his practice of Roman Catholicism
Evidence_Handling: Board questioned applicant's credibility based on incomplete religious knowledge
Evidence_Issues: Dispute over whether minor gaps in religious knowledge undermine credibility
Evidence_Assessment: Court found that applicant demonstrated sufficient religious knowledge to support credibility
Decision_Rationale: Board's expectations for religious knowledge were unreasonably high; decision not within acceptable range
Evidentiary_Issues: Overemphasis on minor inaccuracies in religious knowledge
Legal_Standard_Applied: Reasonableness standard applied to credibility and factual findings
